private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I cannot move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk can be moved; no disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to reach the configuration where left peg has top→bottom C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg has A; right peg has B.

private_information: I can move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk can be moved; no disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to reach the configuration where left peg has top→bottom C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg has A; right peg has B.

private_information: I integrate partial plans and produce the final multi-agent PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward
I keep agent actions distinct and enforce per-agent disk permissions in the domain
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agents to achieve the target configuration and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of the proposed moves
I reject bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or implicit batching
I enforce Tower of Hanoi legality and agent-specific move permissions
auditor.goal: Validate that the integrated sequence of primitive moves is legal, minimal when possible, and leads exactly to the stated goal configuration.

init.ordering: A is the smallest, O the largest

public_information: This is a cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labelled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agents can only move the disks assigned to them: agent_1 may move A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H; agent_2 may move I,J,K,L,M,N,O.
A primitive move transfers the top disk of a peg to the top of another peg.
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top→bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top→bottom C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg has A; right peg has B.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
solution.justification: Move A off the top to free B, then move B to the right. Disks C..O remain undisturbed on the left, satisfying the goal while respecting agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Propose a valid, minimal sequence of primitive moves you can perform limited to disks A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H that achieves the global goal while respecting all Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions. Output a JSON object with fields ordered_moves (array of strings in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2') and rationale (string). Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your capabilities: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide ordered_moves and rationale only; do not emit PDDL.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Determine whether any moves with disks I,J,K,L,M,N,O are required to achieve the goal. If none are needed, return an empty ordered_moves list and explain why. Output a JSON object with fields ordered_moves (array of strings in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2') and rationale (string). Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your capabilities: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide ordered_moves and rationale only; do not emit PDDL.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You are the auditor. Check temporal and causal consistency of the proposed moves, enforce Tower of Hanoi legality, and forbid bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, implicit batching, or unexplained state jumps. Verify agent capability constraints and that the integrated plan reaches the exact goal without moving unnecessary disks. Output a JSON object with fields ordered_moves (single, globally ordered array of primitive moves), invariants_checked (array of strings), and notes (string). Do not emit PDDL.
audit_plan.prompt: Audit the proposals from agent_1 and agent_2 using the public information {environment->public_information}. Ensure each step obeys the rules and agent constraints and that the final configuration matches the goal. If possible, simplify to a minimal sequence of primitive moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that model a two-agent Tower of Hanoi with per-agent move restrictions and the specific initial and goal states given here. Keep actions distinct per agent (for example, move_agent_1 and move_agent_2) and ensure legality constraints. Include types, predicates, and action schemas to enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and agent capabilities. Include all disks A..O and pegs left, middle, right. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the audited move sequence {audited_moves} and the public information {environment->public_information}. Generate a complete, solver-ready PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward reflecting this exact instance. Keep agent-specific actions distinct and include initial and goal states matching the instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
